IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: A CHARTER SCHOOL THAT PROVIDES EACH STUDENT WITH A UNIQUE EDUCATION THAT FITS THEIR ACADEMIC NEEDS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EMPOWER STUDENTS THROUGH AN EXTRAORDINARY CHOICE IN EDUCATION BY PROVIDING PROGRAMS THAT GIVES A VARIETY OF LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO OUR STUDENTS. WE OFFER A RIGOROUS 21ST CENTURY CURRICULUM THAT PREPARES OUR STUDENTS TO COMPETE IN TODAY'S GLOBAL MARKET.
IRS990.Desc: A SEAT TIME TK-12 CHARTER SCHOOL, SERVING STUDENTS FROM THE ORO GRANDE, BARSTOW, VICTORVILLE, HESPERIA, APPLE VALLEY, PHELAN, HELENDALE, OAK HILLS, AND ADELANTO COMMUNITIES. STUDENTS PARTICIPATE IN A COLLEGE PREPARATORY PROGRAM THAT EMPHASIZES PROJECT-BASED LEARNING AND 21ST CENTURY SKILLS. BY DESIGNING AN EIGHT-HOUR INSTRUCTIONAL DAY PROGRAM FOR ALL STUDENTS, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO EXPLORE MULTIPLE PATHWAYS AND TOPICS INCLUDING ATHLETICS, VISUAL AND PERFORMING ARTS, ADVANCED PLACEMENT, AND CIVIC LEARNING PROJECTS. CLASS SIZES ARE WELL BELOW STATE AVERAGES, ADDING TO THE PERSONALIZED LEARNING EXPERIENCES. THE ORO GRANDE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL PROGRAM IS EMBEDDED WITHIN THE RIVERSIDE PREPARATORY ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, EXPANDING THE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AFFECTING ITS ANNUAL FILING REQUIREMENTS, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION WOULD RECOGNIZE FUTURE ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AND LIABILITIES IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE IF SUCH INTEREST AND PENALTIES ARE INCURRED.

THE SCHOOL IS A PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL AND THEREFORE IS NOT SUBJECT TO THE FORMAL COMPLIANCE WITH REVENUE PROCEDURE 75-50 AS LONG AS THE CHARTER AGREEMENT WITH THE STATE IS IN EFFECT. THE SCHOOL DOES INCLUDE INFORMATION REGARDING ITS NON-DISCRIMINATION PRACTICES IN ITS CHARTERING DOCUMENTS WHICH ARE AVAILABLE ON THE SCHOOL WEBSITE.
AS A PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL, THE SCHOOL DOES NOT PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS OR FINANCIAL AID.

AS PART OF ITS OPERATION OF PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS, THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE UNITED STATES AND CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENTS OF EDUCATION AS WELL AS LOCAL PROPERTY TAX REVENUE PASSED-THROUGH THE ORO GRANDE SCHOOL DISTRICT.

ALL EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS PAID FOR BY THE ORO GRANDE SCHOOL DISTRICT (THE "DISTRICT") WITH THE CHARTER'S FUNDS HELD BY THE AUTHORIZING AGENCY IN THE COUNTY TREASURY ACCOUNT. THOUGH ALL INDIVIDUALS EMPLOYED BY THE CHARTER HAVE REPORTABLE COMPENSATION ISSUES UNDER THE DISTRICT'S EMPLOYER IDENTIFICATION NUMBER AND NOT THAT OF THE CHARTER, THE INDIVIDUALS PROVIDE THEIR COMPENSATED SERVICES TO THE CHARTER, EXCEPT WITH RESPECT TO ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF, WHICH ARE SHARED EMPLOYEES BETWEEN THE CHARTER AND THE DISTRICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HOLDS MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING (MOU) WITH THE ORO GRANDE SCHOOL DISTRICT (THE "DISTRICT"), A RELATED GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY, FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND EDUCATIONAL SERVICES, WHICH ALLOWS FOR CONTROL OF CERTAIN MANAGEMENT DUTIES BY MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL OF THE DISTRICT. FOR THIS REASON, DISTRICT MANAGEMENT HAS BEEN LISTED AS KEY PERSONNEL ON THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990, PART VII.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPLETED FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CALIFORNIA FORM 700'S ARE FILED AND REVIEWED ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDIVIDUALS ARE EVALUATED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND NEGOTIATED CONTRACT ARE PREPARED AFTER REVIEWING INDUSTRY NORMS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

THE ORGANIZATION PARTICIPATES IN THE PUBLIC EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT SYSTEM AND STATE TEACHERS RETIREMENT SYSTEM OF CALIFORNIA, DEFINED BENEFIT PLANS, DUE TO THE SIZE AND VARIED PARTICIPANTS IN THIS PLAN THE ACTUARIAL VALUE IS NOT CALCULATED ON A PER EMPLOYEE BASIS. NO AMOUNT IS INCLUDED IN COLUMN F FOR A REASONABLE ESTIMATE OF THE INCREASE IN ACTUARIAL VALUE.

CONTRACTED SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 3,445,716. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 3,445,716. FINGERPRINT: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 2,153. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,153. OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE CHARGES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 129,027. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 129,027. MEALS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 11,843. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 11,843. PROFESSIONAL SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 0. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 5,811,412. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 5,811,412.
